content: felted witches hat details finished size 22 inches 56cm can be felted more or less to fit as desired yarn worsted weight 100% wool 400-500 yards needles and notions us 10/6 mm double points for i-cord switching to circular as needed 8 stitch markers and 1 locking stitch marker gauge 17 sts & 20 row = 4 /10 cm unfleted notes knit top down beginning with an i-cord felted to finish if you would like to have a longer tail on the hat to play with i suggest adding a few extra inches after the second increase there is already quite a bit to play with so you don t have to this hat shrinks more in the circumference than height in my experience read the the whole pattern before you start abbreviations k knit m1 make 1 this is dealers choice use what you re most comfortable with pm place marker bor beginning of round i-cord knit all stitches on one needle instead to turning slide stitches from one end of your dpn to the other end the working yarn comes from the last stitch to begin co 3 stitches knit an i-cord for a total of 3 inches k1 m1 k2 4 knit i-cord until total length is 4 inches k2 m1 k1 m1 k2 6 knit i-cord until total length is 5inches k2 m1 k4 m1 k2 8 knit until i-cord total length is 6 inches ***at this point the i-cord might be looking a bit stretched out dare i say spooky don t worry it will come together during the felting *** k2 m1 k6 m1 k2 10 knit until total length is 7 5 inches switch to working in the round i find this to be a good time to add a beginning of round marker or a locking stitch marker to indicate bor k2 m1 k3 m1 k3 m1 k2 13 knit until total length is 9 inches k2 m1 k4 m1 k4 m1 k3 16 knit until total length is 10 5 inches k2 m1 k4 m1 k4 m1 k4 m1 k2 20 knit until total length is 12 inches k2 m1 k5 m1 k5 m1 k5 m1 k4 24 place a bor marker if you have not already knit 4 row increase row *k3 m1 pm* repeat * until end of row you should have placed 7 additional stitch markers 8 in total counting the bor marker ***every increase row will go as follows *knit to marker m1* repeat * continue knitting this way 4 knit row followed but an increase row until there are a total of 128 stitches 16 stitches between each stitch marker place a locking stitch marker to the first or second stitch of the round knitting row until there are a total of 6 inches from the locking stitch marker brim the brim is increased in a 4 row repeat the 4th row is increased randomly to help the brim have a nice round shape don t
